message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper explores the properties of sentence vector representations, which are commonly used in natural language processing tasks such as sentiment analysis and text classification. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which focuses on natural language processing. The paper also evaluates a wide range of sentence embedding methods, including ones based on deep learning models such as BERT, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper proposes schemes to induce evaluation data based on semantic relationships between sentences, which could also place it in cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper could also be relevant to cs.CV (Computer Vision) as it explores the properties of vector representations of sentences, which could be useful in tasks such as image captioning.
